intro: Glochidion borneense, commonly known as the Bornean Glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo, where it thrives in humid and shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and unisexual flowers, which are typically clustered in inflorescences. It plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
